meanings.sent1: Birds overwinter in warmer regions to avoid the cold.
meanings.sent2: Many animals overwinter by hibernating in their burrows.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels decided to overwinter in the attic, much to the surprise of the homeowners.
meanings.sent4: The memories of summer overwintered in her heart, bringing warmth during the cold months.
meanings.sent5: The flowers bravely overwintered through the frost, waiting for spring to bloom again.

meanings.definition: To pass, spend, or survive the winter
meanings.sent1: The old cabin overwintered many harsh winters without any damage.
meanings.sent2: The bears overwinter in their den, waiting for the snow to melt.
meanings.sent3: The snowman tried to overwinter in the freezer, but he melted too soon.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was strong enough to overwinter any storm that came their way.
meanings.sent5: The ancient tree managed to overwinter countless seasons, standing tall and proud.

meanings.definition: To remain alive or active during the winter
meanings.sent1: The evergreen trees overwinter by retaining their green needles all year.
meanings.sent2: Some insects have special adaptations to overwinter in the cold soil.
meanings.sent3: The snowmen magically overwintered by coming to life when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for painting overwintered through the snowy months, creating beautiful winter landscapes.
meanings.sent5: The river overwintered by flowing gently under the frozen surface, waiting for spring to thaw.
